meanings.sent1: I will outroll the dough to make a pizza.
meanings.sent2: She outrolls the carpet to clean the floor.
meanings.sent3: As the magician waved his wand, the rabbit began to outroll from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The story seemed to outroll like a never-ending scroll of parchment.
meanings.sent5: The red carpet outrolled before the movie stars, welcoming them to the premiere.

meanings.sent1: He can outroll the pastry dough better than anyone in the bakery.
meanings.sent2: The champion baker always manages to outroll his competitors in the contest.
meanings.sent3: The snowball fight turned intense when one team tried to outroll the other with giant snowballs.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to outroll through the room, contagious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The giant wheel of cheese outrolled all the others at the fair, winning the blue ribbon.

meanings.sent1: The mystery novel will outroll its secrets chapter by chapter.
meanings.sent2: The flower petals outroll slowly as the bud opens up to the sun.
meanings.sent3: The map seemed to outroll magically, revealing hidden paths in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her plan began to outroll like a map of possibilities, each step leading to a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise outrolled its colors across the sky, painting it with hues of pink and gold.
